channel.title: Mechscape talk
channel.description:
So i had heard about this mechscape game Jagex's next game (not officially announced as Mechscape) btu to be released in Q1 of 2009.
http://www.mechscapeworld.com/info/
the video on there confirms it.
So it will be made in java, kinda sci-fi, sounds interesting. I might even play it[size=1] or bot it[/size]
Discuss? if theres not already a topic.

item.title: Mechscape talk
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:5, topic:261400”]i can foresee ‘mechscape beta’ phishing sites[/quote]Hehe, pretty witty remark.

Yeah, I have no remarks to this other than I’m probably going to at least try it, i mean, come on. You can’t call something gay without trying it or some viable proof.

Read full topic

item.description:

would be funny if jagex suddenly changed the name or something

I doubt they would, did you see the huge list of domains they have bought up?

http://www.mechscapeworld.com/info/
Scroll down to the domain list.[/quote]

I see they took all the good ones for scamming

item.title: Mechscape talk
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:37, topic:261400”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=345206.msg2674417#msg2674417 date=1234991549]

would be funny if jagex suddenly changed the name or something

I doubt they would, did you see the huge list of domains they have bought up?

Unless they bought LOADS then I doubt it would put a dent in anything…

I’m pretty sure they bought like 30-50.
[/quote]

pricing for each one? that doesnt really sound like a lot of money to me…[/quote]

Depends, the common ones would probably be like $8 per year, the cheap ones like .infos would be like $1-$3 per year, and the expensive ones like .tv would be like $20-$50 per year. But chances are that they get huge discounts for buying domains en masse.

Read full topic

Zezima fans go there, he plays Arcanists.

Arcanist is fun. Kinda like Worms
[/quote]

fanboy what is funorb like?[/quote]
Fanboy of what?
I just like Arcanists because it’s like a big online worms look-alike. I used to play it on my brother’s account. He introuduced me to it. Then I found out you could play with ur rs account. Haven’t played since though

item.title: Mechscape talk
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:261400”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=345206.msg2664126#msg2664126 date=1234413487]

I didn’t think anything was ever going to come from it. I’d say the chances are high that they use the exact same engine, with a different cache of course. That would mean that all of our bots and private servers would already work for mechscape (with only trivial changes), how neat would that be?

I’d actually be a little surprised if they used the old engine. I’m expecting them to, but who isn’t? Since they are starting a new MMO, you would think they’d try to avoid the same mistakes the made in the past.

Their current engine is rather good, what mistakes are you talking about? Why write a whole new engine to do the exact same thing as one you already have does when it does it well? In short, you wouldn’t.

The only reason they would is if it will not be a browser game, does anyone know if it will be or not?

The mistakes of not furthering the prevention of botting. <- double speak, I know, but it gets the idea across
[/quote]

They do a pretty good job of preventing it as it is now. Don’t know what else they could possibly do.[/quote]

A more secure engine and website? I understand the fact that more security = less features. But still, people’s computers are getting more powerful and their engine is staying still. Adding more security would help them far more than hurt them imo.

[quote=“xEnt, post:15, topic:261400”]They said it will be nothing like runescape, and the engine will be upgraded with newer technology.

It could have “mounts” moving spaceships, different view angles, tons of new stuff runescape does not have.

I don’t see a space esque sci-fi type of game with the view runescape has.[/quote]

Unless I’m mistaken, don’t they use the same engine RS uses for all the funorb games?

Read full topic
